title: Grape juicing banned at Tehran fruit market to halt home winemakers
description: Iranian judiciary banned grape juicing at Tehran’s central fruit and vegetable market Wednesday.

title: Parents of Uvalde shooting victims visit school for 1st time since massacre
description: Nineteen children and two teachers were killed at Robb Elementary School. Parents of victims visited the site on Thursday for the first time since the shooting.

title: Groom speaks out after wife killed in accident hours after wedding
description: Aric Hutchinson spoke to “Good Morning America” in his first interview since the tragic accident that killed his new wife.

title: Body camera footage shows pursuit of gunman in deadly New Mexico shooting
description: Body camera footage released by police showed a tense but quick pursuit of a gunman who was randomly firing at homes and cars earlier this week.

title: Attorneys file motion to dismiss case against 'Rust' armorer
description: Attorneys for "Rust" armorer Hannah Gutierrez-Reed have filed a motion Thursday to dismiss her case in the fatal on-set shooting of the film's cinematographer.

title: 2 construction workers missing after massive fire erupts at site
description: A massive five-alarm fire at a Charlotte construction site sent smoke into the air and at least one person to the hospital.

title: Secret Service officer recalled from Bulgaria after off-duty altercation, agency says
description: A Secret Service officer was recalled from Bulgaria after there was "an off-duty altercation with hotel staff," according to a Secret Service spokesperson.

title: Texas man pleads guilty to firearms offense linked to Mexico murder, kidnapping case
description: A Texas man pleaded guilty to smuggling a firearm that authorities linked to the deadly kidnapping involving four U.S. citizens near the border in Mexico.

title: Dianne Feinstein suffered brain inflammation as complication from shingles, rep says
description: Dianne Feinstein suffered complications from shingles that included Ramsay Hunt syndrome and encephalitis, or inflammation of the brain, her office confirmed Thursday

title: Group of North Koreans defect, cross border into South Korea
description: A group of North Koreans crossed the Northern Limit Line in a fishing boat on May 6, South Korean authorities confirmed Thursday.

title: Cash App founder Bob Lee murder suspect pleads not guilty
description: Nima Momeni, a fellow tech executive, entered the plea in a San Francisco court.

title: Supreme Court sides with Twitter, Google in cases on social media, terrorism
description: The Supreme Court on Thursday sided with social media giants in a case brought by families of victims in a terrorist attack in Turkey.

title: Disney cancels planned Florida campus
description: Disney cited "new leadership and changing business conditions," according to a memo.

title: Who pays for medical bills after mass shootings?
description: Costs for injuries after mass shootings fall on taxpayers and employers, experts said.

title: Parents of school shooter Ethan Crumbley appeal order to stand trial
description: The parents of Michigan school shooter Ethan Crumbley have filed appeals to the Michigan Supreme Court after an appeals court ruled they will stand trial in the case.

title: WATCH:  This cat and dog grew up together and are besties
description: Nash and Nala are friends fur-ever!

title: 4 former mall security guards to face trial in 2014 death of Black man
description: Four former mall guards were charged with involuntary manslaughter in the 2014 death of McKenzie Cochran, a then-25-year-old Black man.

title: 2 doses of mpox vaccine were 86% effective against infection, CDC study finds
description: A new CDC report published Thursday found the mpox vaccine was 86% effective at preventing infection when patients received both doses.

title: 'Too much': Parents ask court not to release writings of Nashville school shooter
description: The parents of children killed or traumatized by a mass shooting at Covenant School in Nashville asked a court to prevent the killer's writings from being released.

title: Sam Zell, billionaire real estate investor, dies
description: Sam Zell, a Chicago real estate magnate who earned a multibillion-dollar fortune and a reputation as “the grave dancer” for his ability to revive moribund properties has died due to complications from a recent illness

title: FDA meeting to consider RSV vaccine for pregnant people
description: The Food and Drug Administration will convene to discuss a maternal RSV vaccine option from drugmaker Pfizer.

title: Man charged with killing 5-year-old who was found dead in a suitcase 9 years ago
description: Nine years after the body of a 5-year-old boy was found in a suitcase along the side of a Massachusetts highway, the former boyfriend of the child’s mother faces arraignment on a murder charge in connection with the death

title: Austrian actor Helmut Berger, movie star in the 1960s and 1970s, dies at 78
description: Austrian-born actor Helmut Berger, a European movie star in the 1960s and 1970s who rose to prominence with roles in films by Italian director Luchino Visconti, has died

title: First full-size 3D scan of Titanic shows shipwreck in new light
description: Deep-sea researchers have completed the first full-size digital scan of the Titanic, showing the entire wreck in unprecedented detail and clarity

title: Police: Arrest in NY over death of man pushed onto Baltimore subway tracks
description: Police say a man accused of pushing another man onto the tracks at a Baltimore subway station, electrocuting him, has been arrested in New York

title: Rafael Nadal says he will miss French Open, which he has won a record 14 times
description: Rafael Nadal says he will miss French Open, which he has won a record 14 times

title: Husband of 2-time Olympic champion Justyna Kowalczyk killed in avalanche
description: The Polish Mountaineering Support Foundation says the husband of two-time Olympic champion Justyna Kowalczyk has been killed in an avalanche in the Swiss Alps

title: San Francisco is naming the nation's first drag laureate
description: San Francisco is naming the nation's first drag laureate to represent the city’s famous LGBTQ+ community at a time when rights are under attack

title: Fewer Americans apply for jobless benefits, labor market still showing strength
description: Fewer Americans applied for jobless benefits last week following a spike the previous week that some saw as a sign that higher interest rates were finally hobbling the labor market

title: DeSantis expected to formally enter 2024 race next week: Sources
description: An official kickoff event is expected the week of Memorial Day.

title: 84-year-old climber rescued from mountain in Nepal while seeking record
description: An 84-year-old climber attempting to become the oldest person to summit all the world’s highest peaks has been rescued from a mountain in Nepal where he was injured

title: 7 inmates hospitalized after incident at Washington state jail
description: A medical incident at a Washington jail prompted a significant emergency response and sent seven inmates to the hospital after a potential fentanyl exposure.

title: 8-year-old girl dies in US Border Patrol custody in Texas
description: An 8-year-old girl died while under U.S. Border Patrol custody in Texas on Wednesday, authorities said.

title: Surf's up! Florida's St. George Island beach named nation's best in annual ranking
description: A 9-mile stretch of Florida sugar-white sand is named the best beach in the U.S.

title: China loans pushing world’s poorest countries to brink of collapse
description: A dozen poor countries are facing economic instability and even collapse.

title: On eve of hearing, FBI says it revoked security clearances of 3 agents over Jan. 6
description: The day before a governmental oversight hearing, the FBI says it recently revoked the security clearances of three agents for issues related to the Jan. 6 Capitol attack.

title: Texas Legislature OKs ban on gender-affirming care for minors
description: Texas would soon become the largest state to ban gender-affirming care for minors under a bill now headed to Republican Gov. Greg Abbott

title: 'Heartbreaking': Teen killed at DC high school in 3rd shooting of child this week
description: A 17-year-old was fatally shot at Roosevelt High School in D.C. on Wednesday, police said

title: South Carolina autism clinic director indicted for allegedly defrauding Medicaid
description: The director of an autism clinic in South Carolina was indicted by a federal grand jury Tuesday on 21 counts of health care fraud for allegedly defrauding Medicaid.

title: Turkish voters looking to runoff presidential vote with hope and fear
description: Turkey will hold a May 28 runoff election to determine its next president.
